description: Generated when fddiSMTHoldState (fddimibSMTHoldState)
assumes the state holding-prm or holding-sec. This
notification is a Condition in the Status Report
Protocol (see 7.2.7 and 8.3).
REFERENCE
ANSI { fddiSMT 71 }
Used to uniquely identify an FDDI station.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId

description: This variable indicates the current state of the
Hold function. The value 'not-holding' is the
default and initial value. The value must be set
to 'not-holding' as part of Active_Actions and
when the conditions causing 'holding-prm' or
'holding-sec' are no longer true. The value
'holding-prm' must be set when the condition
(notTR_Flag & not RE_Flag & (PC_LS=QLS | LEM_Fail
| TNE>NS_Max | (not LS_Flag & TPC > T_Out))) is
satisfied in state PC8:ACTIVE for the A Port. The
value 'holding-sec' must be set when the condition
(notTR_Flag & not RE_Flag & (PC_LS=QLS | LEM_Fail
| TNE>NS_Max | (not LS_Flag & TPC > T_Out))) is
satisfied in state PC8:ACTIVE for the B Port.
variables.name: LANPLEX-OPT-FDDI-MIB-1-1-2::lpOptSMTHoldState

description: This condition is active when fddiSMTPeerWrapFlag
(fddimibSMTPeerWrapFlag) is set. This notification is
a Condition in the Status Report Protocol (see 7.2.7
REFERENCE
ANSI { fddiSMT 72 }

Summary.eval: ($v3==1) ? 'SMT peer wrap detected' : 'SMT peer wrap cleared'

description: Used to uniquely identify an FDDI station.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId

description: The attachment configuration for the station or
concentrator (refer to ANSI SMT 9.7.2.2).
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTCFState

description: This variable assumes the value of the
PeerWrapFlag in CFM (refer to ANSI SMT
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTPeerWrapFlag

description: This condition is active when either fddiMACDA-Flag
(fddimibMACDaFlag) or fddiMACUNDA-Flag
(fddimibMACUnaDaFlag) is set. This event is handled
as a Condition in the Status Report Protocol (see 7.2.7
REFERENCE
ANSI { fddiMAC 140 }

Summary.eval: ($v4==1) ? 'MAC duplicate address condition detected' : 'MAC duplicate address condition cleared'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD LANPLEX-OPT-FDDI-MIB-1-1-2::lpOptMACDuplicateAddressCondition DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId s EXAMPLEE DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACSMTAddress s EXAMPL DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACUpstreamNbr s EXAMPL DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACDaFlag i 1 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACUnaDaFlag i 1

description: Used to uniquely identify an FDDI station.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId

description: The 48-bit individual address of the MAC used for
SMT frames.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACSMTAddress

description: The MAC's upstream neighbor's long individual MAC
address. It has an initial value of the SMT-
Unknown-MAC Address and is only modified as
specified by the Neighbor Information Frame
protocol (refer to ANSI SMT 7.2.1 and 8.2).
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACUpstreamNbr

description: The RMT flag Duplicate Address Flag, DA_Flag
(refer to ANSI 10.2.1.2).
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACDaFlag

description: A flag, UNDA_Flag (refer to ANSI 8.2.2.1), set
when the upstream neighbor reports a duplicate
address condition. Cleared when the condition
clears.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACUnaDaFlag

description: Generated when the fddiMACFrameErrorRatio
(fddimibMACFrameErrorRatio) is greater than or equal
to fddiMACFrameErrorThreshold
(fddimibMACFrameErrorThreshold). This event is handled
as a Condition in the Status Report Protocol (see 7.2.7
REFERENCE
ANSI { fddiMAC 141 }

Summary.eval: ($v2==1) ? 'MAC frame error ratio ($v6) exceeded the threshold' : 'MAC frame error ratio ($v6) is normal'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD LANPLEX-OPT-FDDI-MIB-1-1-2::lpOptMACFrameErrorCondition DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId s EXAMPLEE DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACFrameErrorFlag i 1 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACFrameCts c 9999 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACErrorCts c 9999 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACLostCts c 9999 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACFrameErrorRatio i 9999

description: Used to uniquely identify an FDDI station.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId

description: Indicates the MAC Frame Error Condition is
present when set. Cleared when the condition
clears and on station initialization.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACFrameErrorFlag

description: A count of the number of frames received by this
MAC (refer to ANSI MAC 7.5.1).
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACFrameCts

description: A count of the number of frames that were
detected in error by this MAC that had not been
detected in error by another MAC (refer to ANSI
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACErrorCts

description: A count of the number of instances that this MAC
detected a format error during frame reception
such that the frame was stripped (refer to ANSI
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACLostCts

description: This variable is the value of the ratio
((delta fddiMACLostCts + delta fddiMACErrorCts) /
(delta fddiMACFrameCts + delta fddiMACLostCts ))
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACFrameErrorRatio

description: Generated when the fddiMACNotCopiedRatio
(fddimibMACNotCopiedRatio) is greater than or equal to
the fddiMACNotCopiedThreshold (lpOptMACNotCopiedThreshold).
This event is handled as a Condition in the Status Report
Protocol (see 7.2.7 and 8.3).
REFERENCE
ANSI { fddiMAC 142 }

Summary.eval: ($v5==1) ? 'MAC not copied ratio ($v4) reached the threshold' : 'MAC not copied ratio ($v4) is normal'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD LANPLEX-OPT-FDDI-MIB-1-1-2::lpOptMACNotCopiedCondition DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId s EXAMPLEE DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACNotCopiedCts c 9999 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACCopiedCts c 9999 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACNotCopiedRatio i 9999 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACNotCopiedFlag i 1

description: Used to uniquely identify an FDDI station.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId

description: A count that should as closely as possible match
the number of frames that were addressed to this
MAC but were not copied into its receive buffers
(see ANSI MAC 7.5). For example, this might occur
due to local buffer congestion. Because of
implementation considerations, this count may not
match the actual number of frames not copied. It
is not a requirement that this count be exact.
Note that this count does not include MAC frames.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACNotCopiedCts

description: A count that should as closely as possible match
the number of frames addressed to (A bit set) and
successfully copied into the station's receive
buffers (C bit set) by this MAC (refer to ANSI MAC
7.5). Note that this count does not include MAC
frames.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACCopiedCts

description: This variable is the value of the ratio:
(delta fddiMACNotCopiedCts /
(delta fddiMACCopiedCts +
delta fddiMACNotCopiedCts )) * 2**16
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACNotCopiedRatio

description: Indicates that the Not Copied condition is
present when read as true(1). Set to false(2)
when the condition clears and on station
initialization.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACNotCopiedFlag

description: Generated when a change in a MAC's upstream neighbor
address or downstream neighbor address is detected.
REFERENCE
ANSI { fddiMAC 143 }

Summary.eval: (($v2 ne $v3) && ($v4 ne $v5)) ? 'Both upstream and downstream neighbors of MAC have been changed' : (($v2 ne $v3) ? 'Upstream neighbor of MAC has been changed' : 'Downstream neighbor of MAC has been changed')

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD LANPLEX-OPT-FDDI-MIB-1-1-2::lpOptMACNeighborChangeEvent DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId s EXAMPLEE DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACUpstreamNbr s EXAMPL DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACOldUpstreamNbr s EXAMPL DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACDownstreamNbr s EXAMPL DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACOldDownstreamNbr s EXAMPL DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACCurrentPath i 1 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACSMTAddress s EXAMPL

description: Used to uniquely identify an FDDI station.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId

description: The MAC's upstream neighbor's long individual MAC
address. It has an initial value of the SMT-
Unknown-MAC Address and is only modified as
specified by the Neighbor Information Frame
protocol (refer to ANSI SMT 7.2.1 and 8.2).
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACUpstreamNbr

description: The previous value of the MAC's upstream
neighbor's long individual MAC address. It has an
initial value of the SMT-Unknown- MAC Address and
is only modified as specified by the Neighbor
Information Frame protocol (refer to ANSI SMT
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACOldUpstreamNbr

description: The MAC's downstream neighbor's long individual
MAC address. It has an initial value of the SMT-
Unknown-MAC Address and is only modified as
specified by the Neighbor Information Frame
protocol (refer to ANSI SMT 7.2.1 and 8.2).
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACDownstreamNbr

description: The previous value of the MAC's downstream
neighbor's long individual MAC address. It has an
initial value of the SMT- Unknown-MAC Address and
is only modified as specified by the Neighbor
Information Frame protocol (refer to ANSI SMT
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACOldDownstreamNbr

description: Indicates the Path into which this MAC is
currently inserted (refer to ANSI 9.7.7).
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACCurrentPath

description: The 48-bit individual address of the MAC used for
SMT frames.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACSMTAddress

description: This event is generated when the value of the
fddiMACCurrentPath (fddimibMACCurrentPath) changes.
This event shall be supressed if the value changes
from isolated to local or local to isolated (see
REFERENCE
ANSI { fddiMAC 144 }
Used to uniquely identify an FDDI station.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId

description: Indicates the paths available for this MAC (refer
to ANSI SMT 9.7.7).
The value is a sum. This value initially takes
the value zero, then for each type of PATH that
this MAC has available, 2 raised to a power is
added to the sum. The powers are according to the
following table:
Path Power
Primary 0
Secondary 1
Local 2
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACAvailablePaths

description: Indicates the Path into which this MAC is
currently inserted (refer to ANSI 9.7.7).
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACCurrentPath

description: List of permitted Paths which specifies the
Path(s) into which the MAC may be inserted (refer
to ansi SMT 9.7).
The value is a sum which represents the individual
paths that are desired. This value initially
takes the value zero, then for each type of PATH
that this node is, 2 raised to a power is added to
the sum. The powers are according to the
following table:
Path Power
local 0
secondary-alternate 1
primary-alternate 2
concatenated-alternate 3
secondary-preferred 4
primary-preferred 5
concatenated-preferred 6
thru 7
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibMACRequestedPaths

description: This condition becomes active when the value of
fddiPORTLer-Estimate (fddimibPORTLerEstimate)
is less than or equal to fddiPORTLer-Alarm
(fddimibPORTLerAlarm). This will be reported
with the Status Report Frames (SRF) (see 7.2.7
REFERENCE
ANSI { fddiPORT 80 }

Summary.eval: ($v7==1) ? 'Port LER condition detected' : 'Port LER condition cleared'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD LANPLEX-OPT-FDDI-MIB-1-1-2::lpOptPORTLerCondition DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId s EXAMPLEE DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTLerCutoff i 4 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTLerAlarm i 4 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTLerEstimate i 4 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTLemRejectCts c 9999 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTLemCts c 9999 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTLerFlag i 1

description: Used to uniquely identify an FDDI station.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId

description: The link error rate estimate at which a link
connection will be broken. It ranges from 10**-4
to 10**-15 and is reported as the absolute value
of the base 10 logarithm (default of 7).
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTLerCutoff

description: The link error rate estimate at which a link
connection will generate an alarm. It ranges from
10**-4 to 10**-15 and is reported as the absolute
value of the base 10 logarithm of the estimate
(default of 8).
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTLerAlarm

description: A long term average link error rate. It ranges
from 10**-4 to 10**-15 and is reported as the
absolute value of the base 10 logarithm (refer to
ANSI SMT 9.4.7.5.).
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTLerEstimate

description: A link error monitoring count of the times that a
link has been rejected.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTLemRejectCts

description: The aggregate link error monitor error count, set
to zero only on station initialization.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTLemCts

description: The condition becomes active when the value of
fddiPORTLerEstimate is less than or equal to
fddiPORTLerAlarm. This will be reported with the
Status Report Frames (SRF) (refer to ANSI SMT
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTLerFlag

description: Generated when an undesired connection attempt has
been made (see 5.2.4, 7.2.7, and 8.3).
REFERENCE
ANSI { fddiPORT 81 }
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD LANPLEX-OPT-FDDI-MIB-1-1-2::lpOptPORTUndesiredConnAttemptEvent DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId s EXAMPLEE DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTMyType i 1 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTConnectState i 1 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTNeighborType i 1 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTPCWithhold i 1

description: Used to uniquely identify an FDDI station.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId

description: The value of the PORT's PC_Type (refer to ANSI
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTMyType

description: An indication of the connect state of this PORT
and is equal to the value of Connect_State (refer
to ANSI 9.4.1)
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTConnectState

description: The type of the remote PORT as determined in PCM.
This variable has an initial value of none, and is
only modified in PC_RCode(3)_Actions (refer to
ANSI SMT 9.6.3.2).
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTNeighborType

description: The value of PC_Withhold (refer to ANSI SMT
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTPCWithhold

description: Generated when the Elasticity Buffer Error-Ct
(lpOptPORTEBErrorCt) increments. This is handled
as a condition in the Status Report Protocol. It
is generated when an increment occurs in the
station's sampling period (see 7.2.7 and 8.3).
REFERENCE
ANSI { fddiPORT 82 }
Used to uniquely identify an FDDI station.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId

description: A count that should as closely as possible match the
times an Elasticity Buffer Error has occurred while in
active line state.
variables.name: LANPLEX-OPT-FDDI-MIB-1-1-2::lpOptPORTEBErrorCt

description: This event is generated when the value of the
fddiPORTCurrentPath (lpOptPORTCurrentPath)
changes. This event shall be surpressed if the
value changes from isolated to local or local
to isolated (see 7.2.7 and 8.3).
REFERENCE
ANSI { fddiPORT 83 }
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD LANPLEX-OPT-FDDI-MIB-1-1-2::lpOptPORTPathChangeEvent DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId s EXAMPLEE DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTAvailablePaths i 0 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTCurrentPath i 1 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTRequestedPaths s EXA DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTMyType i 1 DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTNeighborType i 1

description: Used to uniquely identify an FDDI station.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibSMTStationId

description: Indicates the Paths which are available to this
Port. In the absence of faults, the A and B Ports
will always have both the Primary and Secondary
Paths available.
The value is a sum. This value initially takes
the value zero, then for each type of PATH that
this port has available, 2 raised to a power is
added to the sum. The powers are according to the
following table:
Path Power
Primary 0
Secondary 1
Local 2
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTAvailablePaths

description: Indicates the Path(s) into which this PORT is
currently inserted.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTCurrentPath

description: This variable is a list of permitted Paths where
each list element defines the Port's permitted
Paths. The first octet corresponds to 'none', the
second octet to 'tree', and the third octet to
'peer'.
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTRequestedPaths

description: The value of the PORT's PC_Type (refer to ANSI
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTMyType

description: The type of the remote PORT as determined in PCM.
This variable has an initial value of none, and is
only modified in PC_RCode(3)_Actions (refer to
ANSI SMT 9.6.3.2).
variables.name: DRAFT-FDDI-MIB-VER-3-2::fddimibPORTNeighborType
